extracted-table.table-caption: Overview of the studies examining alterations in interhemispheric (homotopic) functional connectivity in ASD patients.

caption.p: Overview of the studies examining alterations in interhemispheric (homotopic) functional connectivity in ASD patients.

table-wrap-foot.p: For age and IQs, mean and standard deviation are reported. N (F): Number of subjects and female subjects; VIQ, Verbal IQ; PIQ, Performance IQ; FIQ, Full IQ; EEG, electroencephalographic; ICA, Independent component analysis; ↑ or ↓, Increased or decreased rsFC in autism subjects compared to typically developing subjects;

extracted-table.table-caption: Overview of the studies examining alterations in corpus callosum volume in ASD patients.

caption.p: Overview of the studies examining alterations in corpus callosum volume in ASD patients.

table-wrap-foot.p: For age and IQs, mean and standard deviation are reported. N (F): Number of subjects and female subjects; VIQ, Verbal IQ; PIQ, Performance IQ; FIQ, Full IQ; SBM, Surface-based morphometric analysis; TMA, Traditional morphometric analysis; VBM, Voxel-based morphometric analysis; DKI, diffusional kurtosis imaging; ↑ or ↓, Increased or decreased corpus callosum volume in autism subjects compared to typically developing subjects; N.S, No significant group difference.

extracted-table.table-caption: Overview of the diffusion-weighted imaging studies examining corpus callosum abnormities in ASD patients.

caption.p: Overview of the diffusion-weighted imaging studies examining corpus callosum abnormities in ASD patients.

table-wrap-foot.p: For age and IQs, mean and standard deviation are reported. N (F): Number of subjects and female subjects; VIQ, Verbal IQ; PIQ, Performance IQ; FIQ, Full IQ; TBSS, Tract based spatial statistics; ROI, Region of interest; FA, Fractional anisotropy; MD, Mean diffusivity; RD, Radial diffusivity; AD, Axial diffusivity; ↑ or ↓, Increased or decreased in autism subjects compared to typically developing subjects; N.S, No significant group difference.
